# alicloud\_simple\_application\_server\_disks

This data source provides the Simple Application Server Disks of the current Alibaba Cloud user.

-> **NOTE:** Available in v1.143.0+.

## Example Usage

Basic Usage

```typescript
import * as constructs from "constructs";
import * as cdktf from "cdktf";
/*Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.*/
import * as alicloud from "./.gen/providers/alicloud";
class MyConvertedCode extends cdktf.TerraformStack {
  constructor(scope: constructs.Construct, name: string) {
    super(scope, name);
    const dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksDiskType =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks.DataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks(
        this,
        "diskType",
        {
          diskType: "System",
        }
      );
    const dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksIds =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks.DataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks(
        this,
        "ids",
        {
          ids: ["example_id"],
        }
      );
    const dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksInstanceId =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks.DataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks(
        this,
        "instanceId",
        {
          instanceId: "example_value",
        }
      );
    const dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksNameRegex =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks.DataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks(
        this,
        "nameRegex",
        {
          nameRegex: "^my-Disk",
        }
      );
    const dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksStatus =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks.DataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisks(
        this,
        "status",
        {
          status: "In_use",
        }
      );
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "simple_application_server_disk_id_1", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(
        dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksIds.disks,
        ["0", "id"]
      ),
    });
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "simple_application_server_disk_id_2", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(
        dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksNameRegex.disks,
        ["0", "id"]
      ),
    });
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "simple_application_server_disk_id_3", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(
        dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksStatus.disks,
        ["0", "id"]
      ),
    });
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "simple_application_server_disk_id_4", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(
        dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksInstanceId.disks,
        ["0", "id"]
      ),
    });
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "simple_application_server_disk_id_5", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(
        dataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerDisksDiskType.disks,
        ["0", "id"]
      ),
    });
  }
}

```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `ids` - (Optional, ForceNew, Computed)  A list of Disk IDs.
* `instanceId` - (Optional, ForceNew) The ID of the simple application server to which the disk is attached.
* `nameRegex` - (Optional, ForceNew) A regex string to filter results by Disk name.
* `diskType` - (Optional, ForceNew) The type of the disk. Possible values: `system`, `data`.
* `outputFile` - (Optional) File name where to save data source results (after running `terraform plan`).
* `status` - (Optional, ForceNew) The status of the disk. Valid values: `reIniting`, `creating`, `inUse`, `available`, `attaching`, `detaching`.

## Argument Reference

The following attributes are exported in addition to the arguments listed above:

* `names` - A list of Disk names.
* `disks` - A list of Simple Application Server Disks. Each element contains the following attributes:
	* `category` - Disk type. Possible values: `essd`, `ssd`.
	* `createTime` - The time when the disk was created. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the `yyyyMmDdThh:mm:ssZ` format. The time is displayed in UTC.
	* `device` - The device name of the disk on the simple application server.
	* `diskId` - The first ID of the resource.
	* `diskName` - The name of the resource.
	* `diskType` - The type of the disk. Possible values: `system`, `data`.
	* `id` - The ID of the Disk.
	* `instanceId` - Alibaba Cloud simple application server instance ID.
	* `paymentType` - The payment type of the resource. Valid values: `payAsYouGo`, `subscription`.
	* `size` - The size of the disk. Unit: `gb`.
	* `status` - The status of the disk. Valid values: `reIniting`, `creating`, `inUse`, `available`, `attaching`, `detaching`.
